title: No alien life discovered on Earth, Pentagon says, but search deepens
description: The Defense Department's new All-domain Anomaly Resolution Office is evaluating recent reports of unexplained phenomena and accounts that date back decades.

title: What to know before buying a Steam Deck for the holidays
description: Before you buy a Steam Deck this holiday season, there are a few things you should know about its battery life, game compatibility and more.

title: ‘Among Us’ could have been too scary in virtual reality, developers say
description: "Among Us," its developers say, is all about "lying to your friends, and everything else should be in service of that."

title: The Pokémon anime is moving away from Ash and Pikachu. We have questions.
description: The Pokémon anime is moving on from its iconic main character duo of Ash Ketchum and Pikachu. What will this mean for the series and its fans?

title: YouTube is pushing educational kids videos. Can parents trust them?
description: YouTube is trying to repair its bad reputation with families. Can YouTube's educational goals for children work alongside its commercial mission?

title: Musk’s suspension of journalists on Twitter spurs E.U. sanctions warning
description: The rebuke comes ahead of tough E.U. rules on content moderation and disinformation that are set to take effect in 2024.

title: FTC case shows just how badly Mark Zuckerberg wanted a VR fitness app
description: A fitness app was seen as a way to attract more women to the metaverse, which was dominated by young male gamers.

title: After delays, Rocket Lab is set for launch from NASA’s Wallops spaceport
description: The Rocket Lab launch should be visible to people in Washington and the mid-Atlantic region.

title: AI can now create images out of thin air. See how it works.
description: Use our simulator to learn how AI generates images from “noise.”

title: Elon Musk’s ‘Twitter files’ are an exercise in hypocrisy
description: Internal documents show how a small group of executives molded online discourse. Under Musk, that’s more of a problem than ever.
